result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion and Demand for Discovery & Inspection

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with JRG, IJA or JKK; Not be present in any establishment whose primary purpose is sale/serving of alcohol.
22R 014763 Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott D Lindoerfer in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Scott D Lindoerfer. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def does not qualify for SPD and req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Borkowicz.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $100 per month commencing 8-15-22.  Court sets $500 cash bond.  Court enters NG pleas on behalf of def.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
